page.title: 08Mill Close
page.content: {Mill Close development}was carried out in{1977.}The Council{Architect} responsible for it was{Mr Dan Gregory. In the close there are parking spaces for cars but no garages. There are grassed areas to play on and a grit/salt box for the Winter. There is {no gas supply}in this area and people have to use{coal, coke or electricity as fuels for heating and cooking etc. The houses are built of{sandstone} and{Nos. 1-11}have{grey slate roofs whilst{Nos 12-15}have{red pantiles.} There are four bungalows for the elderly with{"HELP"}emergency lights outside the doors. When the houses were first built there were no fences separating them but some occupiers have since built there own boundary fences. Some of these houses are owner occupied whilst others are rented from Richmondshire District Council.
